H0.text: Accurate records must be kept in order for scientific data to be verified through repetition.

H1.text: Modern technology must be used in order for scientific data to be verified through repetition.

H2.text: Investigations must be conducted by trained scientists in order for scientific data to be verified through repetition.

H3.text: Observations must be made by more than one scientist in order for scientific data to be verified through repetition.

A4.text: The term reproducible research refers to the idea that scientific results should be documented in such a way that their deduction is fully transparent. This requires a detailed description of the methods used to obtain the data and making the full dataset and the code to calculate the results easily accessible.

A5.text: The use of software and automation enhances the reproducibility of research methods.

A6.text: The National Institute of Standards and Technology provides guidelines on expressing uncertainty in measurement results, which contributes to accurate record-keeping.
